intro: Iozoste rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf iozoste, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its rounded, broad leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it remains relatively rare in horticultural trade.
